name.description: The name of your action. DataTorch displays the name when the action is ran.

author.description: The name of the action's author.

inputs.description: Input parameters allow you to specify data that the action expects to use during runtime.

^[_a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*$.description: A string identifier to associate with the input.

type.description: Expected type of the input to be.

description.description: A string description of the input parameter.

deprecationMessage.description: A string shown to users using deprecated inputs.

required.description: A boolean to indicate whether the action requires the input parameter. Set to true when the parameter is required.

default.description: The default value is used when an input parameter isn't specified in a workflow file.

outputs.description: Output parameters allow you to specify the data that subsequent actions can use later in the workflow after the action that defines these outputs has run.

^[_a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*$.description: A string identifier to associate with the output.

type.description: Expected type of the input to be.

description.description: A string description of the input parameter.

runs.description: Describes how to execute the action.

using.description: The application to use to execute the code specified in main.

main.description: Required for 'python' and 'node': The code file that contains your action code.

image.description: Required for 'docker': The Docker image to use as the container to run the action.
